(Chapter and Options originally written by SandySeeker)

Roy Milford hated his life.

He glanced out his dirty, second story apartment window at his broken down car sitting out in the parking lot. He was going to need a new transmission, but there was no way he could afford that on his meager salary.

Sighing heavily, Roy went to put on his work uniform. His shift started in just under an hour.

Roy had always figured that by the time he was twenty-three his life would be better than this. He'd done well in high school, gone on to college... but now somehow things had fallen apart for Roy. He still shared a tiny apartment with a roommate (his best friend Jack). He himself had no girlfriend. And the best job he could find was slaving away as Assistant Manager at the local Burger Bonanza establishment. In essence, he was a glorified burger flipper, working alongside teenage kids and high school drop-outs, earning little more than their minimum wage.

“I hate my life,” Roy reiterated, sliding on his Burger Bonanza uniform shirt.

“You shouldn't,” said a strangely familiar voice.

Roy spun around and was greeted by his own spitting image – only better dressed and more confident and happy-looking.

“Who are you?” Roy sputtered.

“Why, I'm you of course!” said the doppelganger. “Or rather, I'm apparently a considerably more successful version of you.”

“Huh?” asked Roy.

“Indulge me for a moment,” replied his twin. “I'm you – from an alternate reality. And from the looks of this dump, I'd guess my world is at least four or five-hundred years technologically more advanced than yours. Does this place even have running water and electricity?”

“Yes,” scowled Roy.

“Well, where I come from, we've got a lot more,” continued Roy's double. “And I'm a much more successful version of... well... you! I'm an independently wealthy scientist and inventor. And right now, I'm using one of my latest inventions to explore and chart some of the nearby alternate universes. There's an infinite number of parallel realities out there, you know. Your world is... oh, let's see... QLX-0948-Kappa-Delta-IV, from the Negative Purple-3 Spectrum, of course.”

“Oh, of course,” muttered a thoroughly confused Roy.

“Listen, brother,” said Roy's duplicate with a sympathetic smile. “I hate seeing myself like this. Especially since I know what a brilliant genius you're capable of being, if only given the proper chance. I've got to get going – lots more realities to map, y'know. But before I go, let me leave you with a little gift.”

The Other Roy rummaged around in a belt pouch for a moment, finally retrieving a thin, rectangular object that vaguely resembled a high-tech cellphone of some kind.

“I made this,” said the Alternate Roy with a proud smile. “Totally unique item. I think you may find it extremely useful in these barbaric, backwards, dark ages. It's a Role Swapper. It actually alters reality and re-writes history! With this, you can re-create your own personal history and give yourself the sort of life you deserve to have. Just point it at a target and press the button on the left... then point it at a second target and press the button on the right. The Role Swapper will re-write history so that everyone believes the two targets were actually each other! The only person immune to this memory-rewriting-feature will be yourself... or whomever is holding the device. So don't let this little beauty fall into the wrong hands! And once you've swapped yourself into a life story you're happy and content with, it'd be best to destroy the machine.”

“Uh, thanks,” muttered a thoroughly confused Roy, accepting the gift.

“Listen, buddy, I gotta go!” said Future Roy. “But best of luck with this thing. Hang in there and believe in yourself! Like I said: I know from firsthand experience just a brilliant and visionary genius you have the potential to be!”

With that, the Parallel Reality version of Roy abruptly flickered out of existence leaving the Original Roy standing in his cramped little bedroom, still half-dressed in his work uniform.

“Guess I should test out this crazy gizmo,” Roy mumbled to himself.

Who does Roy select as his target?

“Let's try this on Sarah,” Roy said to himself. “Just to see if it really works.”

Sarah Howard was the girlfriend of Roy's roommate Jack Sutton. She spent basically all of her free time over here at the apartment, completely devoted to Jack. Sarah was smart, pretty in that “Girl-Next-Door” way, and had a much better job, as a junior librarian at the university library. Roy knew that early in the morning, she'd be in the apartment's kitchen busily making coffee and breakfast for Jack.

Roy quickly finished dressing himself in his fast food uniform, then crept out towards the kitchen. Sure enough, there was Sarah, already fully dressed, and busily frying an egg for Jack while he took his morning shower. She had the small, portable TV in the kitchen switched on and was absent-mindedly watching some gossip show about celebrity trivia.

She had dark, shoulder-length hair carefully styled in a bit of a bob. She wore a light blue, long-sleeved blouse with a blue sweater on over it. She had on black, professional looking women's slacks, some dark nylon socks, and a pair of sensible, brown shoes with a slight wedge heel to them. Although she wore glasses, they weren't too terribly thick and just looked “cute” on her. She'd already put on a modest amount of makeup this morning.

Roy stealthily aimed the device at the back of Sarah's head and pushed the left button.

Nothing happened.

Roy knew he needed a secondary target to complete this supposed Role Swap. So to test out the device, he selected his target.

What is it?

“Jack, I've got something to tell you,” said Roy to his roommate.

“Hmmmmm?” replied Jack, with a mouth full of scrambled eggs.

“I'm not really Sarah,” said Roy. “I'm actually Roy.”

Jack raised an eyebrow and shot Roy a dirty look, but said nothing. He continued shoveling eggs into his mouth.

“I'm serious,” Roy insisted. “I am not Sarah. I'm Roy – your friend and roommate... and a guy.”

“Sarah, what the hell are you babbling on about?” said Jack with a tired, frustrated expression on his face.

Roy knew his roommate wasn't much of a Morning Person. Maybe this wasn't the best time to tell him this news. Oh well, thought Roy.

“It's this little gizmo,” Roy said, pulling out the high-tech gadget from Sarah's slacks. “I got this from a visitor from an alternate reality. A real, life, genuine parallel earth! He was an alternate version of me, a brilliant inventor in his own world. Anyhow, this device can switch around people's 'life roles,' whatever that means exactly. I've only experimented with it once – on me and Sarah. It zapped us into each other's clothes, and she wound up believing she was really me.”

“Did Roy put you up to this?” sighed Jack, turning his attention back to breakfast.

“I am Roy,” insisted Roy.

“Well, you still look just like Sarah to me,” mumbled Jack.

“Then perhaps a demonstration is in order,” said Roy. “Oh... but you wouldn't be aware of any changes would you? Just like Sarah, you'd only remember the new reality. But... hmmmmmm... what if... what if we held hands when I use the device?”

“Oh, all right,” sighed Jack impatiently. “If it'll keep you satisfied, I'll play along with your little game. But hurry it up, Sarah. I still gotta get dressed and go to work.”

“Fine,” said Roy.

Although it seemed a little fruity, Roy grasped Jack's hand firmly and looked for a target.

“How about... oh perfect!” said Roy. “How about us?”

Still holding Jack's hand, he fired the device once at Jack and once again at himself.

“See, nothing happ--... OHMIGOD!” screamed Jack.

He was no longer sitting at the table but was now standing up and wearing all of Sarah's clothes.

Roy, now sitting down and wearing nothing but a towel, smiled a toothy grin back at his roommate.

“See,” he said. “Told you I'm really Roy. Well... everyone else now thinks I'm you. And they'll all think you're Sarah.”

“Shit!” said Jack, still staring down at himself. He was physically the same, but now wearing Sarah's glasses, a bit of makeup, all her clothes... even his hair had grown out into the same style she wore. All of the clothes now perfectly fit his body.

“Believe me?” laughed Roy, eating a spoonful of Jack's plate of eggs.

“Change us back this instant!” yelled Jack.

“Anything you say, 'Sarah,'” laughed Roy.

Roy grasped Jack's hand again and quickly fired the device off in quick succession at the two of them.

Instantaneously, Jack found himself again seated at the table, clad in nothing but a towel, and munching on a fresh mouthful of eggs.

“Although that still leaves me playing the role of Sarah,” muttered Roy. “But I figure I'll switch myself back with her after she's done working my shift for me today.”

What next?

111132221111.content:

Great, thought Roy. This is a really swell gift from my stupid double from his stupid alternate universe. I'm now trapped in the body of some strange woman named 'Tonya.' And my best friend Jack has become someone named 'Janet'... and he actually believes he's really her! What can possibly go wrong now?

Roy looked down at the device, still smoldering ever so slightly. The tiny LED screen was now flashing a new message: “Energy depletion. Micro Tokamak will require 72 hours to recharge reserves. Do not attempt usage before then. Have a nice day!”

Seventy-Two hours thought Roy. That's three days. Would he have to spend the next three days as this strange woman named Tonya? The only thing he even knew about her was her name... and that she went jogging with this Janet woman. How was Roy supposed to live Tonya's life for the next three days?!?

Wait a minute, reflected Roy. The earlier error message said the longer he stayed like this, the more he'd start acquiring the memories and personality of this body. After 72 hours, would Roy even remember being Roy? By the time the device was fully re-charged and capable of undoing all these swaps to put everything right again... would Roy even want to swap back? By then, he'd know all about Tonya's life – to the point that he'd probably be thinking and acting just like her. And the odds were pretty slim she'd want to use the Role Swapper to willingly trade lives with some guy who worked at a fast food restaurant.

“I said come on, Tonya!” whined the body of Janet (inhabited unknowingly by Jack). “I said class is starting soon! Are you coming back to campus with me or not? We still have to get changed and then get to class. We're gonna be late, Tonya! What's the hold-up?”

It might be best, thought Roy, to just go with Jack. At least he had all of Janet's memories right now. He could guide Roy around a bit... at least until Roy's mind began to inevitably get flooded with Tonya's memories and personality.

“I... I'm coming Jack... uh... Just a minute,” Roy stammered. “Just a... just a minute, Janet.”

Maybe, thought Roy, while in Tonya's class he could write himself a detailed note explaining everything. Then seal that into an envelope and put it, along with the device, someplace where only Tonya would find it three days from now. Then, he supposed, the best he could hope for would be Tonya actually believing the wild story in the note. Was it worth a shot?

A feeling of dread washed over Roy as they pulled into the mall parking lot. He knew that he was taking yet another step down the road to womanhood by participating in the timeless ritual of finding the perfect prom dress. Roy couldn't think of where to start looking first, so Stacy took the lead and led him into the nearest department store.

When they reached the Junior's department, Roy had a hard time taking in the fact that he was going to have to leave with one of these dresses. It didn't comfort him in the least to see that there were plenty of other girls ("other" girls?) who were here for the same reason. Roy's head almost started spinning as Stacy bombarded him with questions.

"Do you have a favorite color?" "Short or long?" "Strapless okay?" "How about a halter top?" "Do you like this bodice? What do you think of this fabric?"

After going through the selection for a while, Roy noticed Stacy had collected multiples of a couple dress designs.

"Why are you grabbing duplicates?"

"Oh, well that's just because we don't know your exact size yet. You're going to have to try these on."

Roy felt his heart drop for a moment as he figured out that this wasn't going to be a quick and easy process. His only moment of excitement came when he walked into the dressing area and started noticing several girls cute girls around his age were in there with him. This was forbidden territory for sure, but all they noticed was another girl walking into a dressing room rather than a guy who was barely a girl biologically due to the Role Swapper.

Trying on each dress was a chore in and of itself. It wasn't so bad getting undressed and maneuvering the dress into position. It was having to hold it in place while walking out of the dressing room only to have Stacy zip him into it so he can model it in front of the three panel mirror. He then would have to get unzipped and once again walk gingerly back to the dressing room to change dresses. This was a tedious unnecessary process to Roy, but he was stuck, plain and simple.

After settling on which dress he liked the most, Roy was stunned when Stacy took it up to the cashier only to ask her to put it on hold for them.

"What are you doing?"

"Putting the dress on hold for you."

"Why can't we just buy it and leave?"

"That's easy! You can't just settle on the first dress you find. We're going to go to another store and see if you can't do better!"

Roy screamed on the inside. "NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!"

After several hours of trying on prom dresses, he found himself finally purchasing a dress. Stacy applauded him on a hard day's work and gave him a peck on the cheek.

"You're going to look great Roy."

Roy could feel himself blush momentarily as he was once again getting a larger amount of affection from Stacy than he was used to getting. The cashier finished ringing up the sale and handed Roy his prom dress inside a protective bag. He was still stunned that he had his very own prom dress now.

The dress was something he would have loved to have seen on any other girl. It was burgundy with a beaded, lace up bodice. Its skirt was actually rather short, but even though he had wanted to wear something a little longer, Roy ended up deciding to go with this one after he tripped over another dress's hem earlier. He couldn't help but wonder how good Stacy would've looked in the dress instead of himself. http://www.landy-bridal.com/media/catalog/product/cache/1/image/9df78eab33525d08...

With a prom dress in hand, Roy and Stacy took a moment to eat at the food court before doing anything else. Roy suggested they do something fun like catch a movie, but Stacy shot down his idea.

"We're not done here at the mall yet."

"Huh? But we just finished buying my prom dress."

"You're absolutely correct. Now we need to get your shoes, a purse to match the dress, some pantyhose to complete the outfit, and we need to make your hair appointment for Friday."

"Fuck!"

The jeans took a little effort to squeeze into, but otherwise, Roy didn't have much trouble with the clothing... though he was sure it would be a different story when he had to wrestle with her bra later on. It was the perfect car for a Burger Bonanza employee, especially one who was still in high school: boxy, practical, and spotted with rust. Taking Jessica's keys from her purse, Roy jumped inside.

"Yeah... we've got a lot of alcohol. Friends come over a lot and we hang out. Your friends, my friends, they're all cool. You know you always prefer to drink the-"

Paul stared nervously for several seconds before adding, "Yeah I don't know, but hey you remembered there's a party tonight, awesome! It's mostly my friends coming, but you're free to invite some of yours, it'll help you remember them!"

But Erika still had the thought on the tip of her tongue. "No, no... I mean someone important was going to be there, I feel like there was a reason I was looking forward to this party."

"You know, maybe we should just call off the party, you're clearly not feeling well. I mean you lost your memory so you're not in any state to get blackout drunk. What kind of boyfriend would I be if I let you do that in this state?"

"Not a very good one... But I'm serious, no! We have to have this party, I just know there's something important going to happen." She insisted. When Paul didn't respond, she added, "Paul! We're having this party alright? I don't know why you suddenly don't want me to think about partying, when just a minute ago you were saying how awesome it was."

He sighed, "Right of course, let's party like there's no tomorrow, right? We should probably go to the store and pick up some snacks and clean this place up before people get here tonight. How about you go change and let me know when you're ready?"

It wasn't the classiest party around, but Erika still wanted to look her best. Unfortunately she seemed to have some trouble at first applying makeup and picking out the right outfit to wear. She spent half an hour retouching her eye makeup, retouching, cleaning, and starting over, several times until she finally was happy with it. It was like she had the knowledge of how to apply it, but her subconscious motor skills needed to be trained all over again.

Once her makeup was sorted out, she spent quite some time going through her closet for what she thought was appropriate party material. She found a little black dress that brought back a vivid memory of her first kiss a few years ago. The dress was slight overkill for a casual party like this, but it wasn't really formal, so she knew she could get away with it. Somehow something was telling her that this was her lucky dress, and tonight needed to be the night to bring it back out after all these years.

"Yeah, let's do this! I don't know why, but let's!" Erika exclaimed to herself, as she just went with the gut feelings of her new memories.

Finally she was ready. Her brunette hair ended up falling to her shoulders in styled waves when let out of its ponytail, something she was grateful she didn't have to spend much time on. Her strapless dress was definitely the highlight of the ensemble, and thankfully it fit perfectly, even despite her DD cleavage threatening to burst out of the top. It came down to mid-thigh, a rather sexy length, and she still wondered who she was trying to impress with this. Finally her black pumps added five inches to her height, which was sorely needed since she was barely 5'3" without them.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---

By the time she left her bedroom, the first few guests had already arrived, and were getting started on a few beers. A guy and a girl were hanging out in the living room with Paul, and they were clearly a cute couple the way they sat close to each other. Erika smiled and entered the room feeling suddenly quite self-conscious about her appearance. The other girl wasn't anywhere near as dressed up, but she seemed impressed by Erika's effort.

"Wooow girl, you are pulling all the stops tonight huh? That dress is drop dead sexy, there's no way he's gonna miss that!" The young woman on the couch praised.

"Thanks!" Blushed Erika.

Paul jumped in, "Yeah how could I miss that? I mean, damn babe, you should wear that dress more often!"

The man next to the other woman laughed, "'Babe'? Wait is something going on that we missed here? You two…?"

Paul didn't give Erika much chance to respond, "Oh yeah! For quite a while actually! I didn't know it was a secret!"

Erika slowly nodded, "Yeah… it's no secret right?"

The other man shrugged, "I dunno, it's news to me! Wow, you're gonna have to give me the deets on this later, Paul, damn!"

While that man seemed surprised and impressed, his girlfriend with him on the couch seemed concerned. "Wait hold on, girl. You and Paul are a thing? And you got all dressed up for a casual party at home? What the hell happened to Brad? You ain't makin any sense girl."

Erika nervously looked to Paul who seemed to be sweating bullets. Once again, he interjected, "Brad said he couldn't make it, something about car trouble, real shame. But yeah, I'm really grateful to have a girlfriend like her who puts this much effort into her appearance, even for things like this! She really went all out!"

She didn't know what was going on anymore, or who to believe. Something definitely didn't add up, and she was about to snap. She looked intensely at the other girl and asked, "Hey, did you wanna see my room real quick? I've got some new things I wanna show you."

Of course Erika had no idea who this girl was, but she seemed to be on her side. She hoped this girl would be able to make some sense of what was going on.

She seemed to get the hint, and quickly agreed to talk privately in their room. As the two of them left, Erika once again noticed how awkward Paul looked right now.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------< br />
Once the bedroom door shut, the girl blurted out, "What the fuck is happening Erika? You and Paul? Really? You said just last week how he creeps you out when he gets all flirty, and you called him a 'white knight', and not in a good way. Am I to understand that you gave up on Brad for your weird-ass roommate? YOU CAN DO BETTER THAN THIS."

Erika couldn't even process all of this information quick enough, "Hey whoa, quiet down, ok? I don't want them to hear ok? I called you in here to figure out what's going on, myself. So wait, you said we last saw each other last week?"

The other girl composed herself again, "Sorry, this is just absurd. Yeah, at the last party, you don't remember? You were literally talking shit about Paul, and now this."

Erika nearly broke down in tears, "Oh my god I’m such an idiot, why did I let myself fall into this, I'm just being used!"

"You aren't making any sense girl, come on. Are you saying you 'forgot' Paul was a manipulative weirdo and you were just waiting for the lease to expire so you could get the fuck out of this place?"

She couldn't hold back the tears any longer, and they completely ruined her painstakingly applied eye makeup. "Shit, shit, shit… I'm a dumbass, why!?"

"NO, you're not. Tell me what's up, cause I know you're smart enough not to fall for his shit."

Erika sniffled through her tears, "Look, it all happened so fast, and I thought I could trust him. I had no one to turn to. I lost my memory recently, but it's been slowly coming back to me. He convinced me I was his girlfriend! I believed it all hook line and sinker!"

The other young woman took a step back, "Oh my god, you lost your memory, WHY DIDN'T YOU SAY SOMETHING?! Or go to a doctor?!""It happened today, there was no time! I really felt like I needed to go to this party because for some reason I was supposed to meet someone important, and then for some reason I got all dressed up to impress…"

"Yeah, to impress BRAD. You know, the guy you've had a crush on since high school? You haven't seen him in years and tonight was supposed to be his first time back in town! We were all gonna have drinks together and catch up on old times. There's no way he would have missed this party because of 'car trouble'. That fucker Paul must have told him not to come, so he could sell his bullshit on a vulnerable girl with no memory!"

Erika felt this girl's rage and more, and blurted out, "I don't know what to do, I still have so many gaps in my memory, I don't even know your name, I'm sorry!"

"It's Tammy sweetie, I'm your friend! Look forget about all of this for a minute. You lost your memory, this is no time for drama.. I bet you don't even know who Brad is do you? That's not important right now. What's important is that you try to remember as much as possible. Not the shit Paul's been feeding you, but your own memories."

"Thanks Tammy… Yeah I have been getting memories back all day, but it's all just bits and pieces. I remember things about the classes I'm taking, and this lucky dress, which might not be so lucky after all. I remember what kind of drinks I like, and that my favorite flavor of ice cream is uh… sherbet. Yeah, I know, right? But memories of people, like Paul, or you, or even Brad. They just don't come up. Even my memory of this party was just, I knew something big was supposed to happen."

"Good! Just keep trying to remember things! Let's go back out and see if anyone else has shown up. I'll stall them while you clean your eyes real quick. Just play along with whatever Paul's up to for now, and we can nail him on his bullshit once and for all!" Tammy said, patting Erika gently on the shoulder.

After spending a few minutes fixing her eye makeup as best she could, Erika finally made it back to the party. She was still an emotional wreck, but had at least stopped crying, so she was eventually able to compose herself. However, this didn't last long as when she stepped into the room she saw a man that made her stop dead in her tracks. He had stunning good looks, with his vibrant green eyes that she quickly got lost in, and a quite athletic body. She had to remind herself to stop standing there gawking, and sit back down for a drink.

Her presence was noticed by everyone in the room, who couldn't help but stop what they were doing to check her out. She blushed and sat down across from the man she couldn't take her eyes off, and quickly poured out a beer for herself.

"Oh, hey Erika! It's been a while, huh?" The man said, while clearly undressing her with his eyes.

If she had taken her eyes off the man long enough, she would have noticed Paul next to her was staring daggers at this man. But he remained silent for now.

Erika didn't know how to respond, but at the sound of his voice, she instantly knew this was Brad. This was who she got all dolled up for, and was trying to impress, according to Tammy at least. More memories began to rush in. She remembered going to her senior prom with Brad, as friends, because he'd just broken up with his date at the time and needed someone else to go with. She remembered the massive crush she developed on him, and how she always tried to look her best when he was around. But nothing happened after prom night, and after high school, Brad moved out of town, and they hadn't seen each other since.

"Hello? Earth to Erika?" Tammy asked, giving her a verbal kick in the butt.

"Huh?! Oh yeah! It's really good to see you Brad! I'm so glad you were able to make it after all! You managed to get here despite the car trouble?"

He furrowed his brow, "Uh, na my car is just fine? I just needed to pick up some booze on the way. I heard you liked doing shots of Fireball. Not really my thing, but figured you'd like it."

That's when Erika noticed the bottle he was holding, which he set on the table, along with some shot glasses.
"Hell yeah! How did you know that?" She wondered out loud.

Finally, Paul inserted himself into the conversation. "Everyone knows that, babe. It's no secret." He placed his arms around Erika, as though claiming her as his own. "So another thing that's no secret, Erika and I are kind of a thing now, have been for quite some time."

Brad looked quite surprised, not imagining the two of them would ever be an item, considering how she was way out of Paul's league, and never showed any attraction to him in the past. However, he was even more surprised when Erika squirmed her way out of Paul's arms, pushing herself further away on the couch.

"So who wants to take some shots with me, we've got everything right here!" Erika blurted out, grabbing the bottle of Fireball, and completely ignoring what Paul said.

Tammy jumped at the opportunity, "Oh I will! Pour one out!"

Erika poured three shots, and offered one to Brad, "You want one? It's your bottle."

"Well it's your bottle now, but sure, I'll take one I guess. It's not my thing, but sure." He smiled, taking the glass.

Together the three of them threw back a shot of whiskey, getting an excellent start to the party. Meanwhile, Paul just sat there looking rejected, and embarrassed by the way Erika was ignoring him for Brad. When she began pouring out the second round of shots, Brad went back to his beer, while Tammy eagerly joined in and continued downing more whiskey with Erika. The alcohol was flowing, and she was quickly gathering up enough courage not to put up with Paul's shit anymore.

"Hey babe, don't you think you're going a bit fast? Why don't you have a beer or something?" Paul tried to take the bottle of whiskey away, but Erika grabbed it out of his hands.

"Don't fucking call me babe, alright? I barely know you!" She blurted out, the alcohol setting off her temper quite fast.

But Paul wasn't about to give up that easily, "Erika, you've known me for years, what are you talking about? We live together for fuck's sake, how could you say that? You've loved me for a long time now!"

Erika took one more shot, and then slammed the glass down on the table, "Bullshit! I know I've forgotten a lot of things, but I'm not as dumb as you think I am. I remember enough to know how much you've been lying to me, and I do NOT love you."

Paul put his hand on her shoulder, but she spun around and slapped him in the face, really feeling the alcohol. "Fuck off Paul, seriously! You know what? I'm moving out tomorrow. I can't stand this shit. I don't know where I'm going to go, but anywhere's better than here!"

After slapping Paul and yelling in his face, Erika got up and walked out of the room, retreating to her bedroom, not wanting Brad to see her this way. As she was leaving, she heard muffled voices of everyone at the party giving Paul shit for what he was doing, and he seemed to be trying to defend himself. But she was too emotional to bother paying attention to any of that. Erika slammed her door behind her, kicked her heels off and flopped onto her bed.

-----------------------------------------------------

"Wow, what the fuck did you do Paul? She seems devastated! Clearly she's not into you, so why did you keep making up lies?" Tammy's boyfriend, John asked.

"I… it's not lies though. I thought she really did like me. Why would she just break up with me like that in front of all of you guys." Paul said, continuing to try and spin a new lie, but he was quickly falling apart.

Brad just shook his head, "I don't know, none of this makes sense. But next time she needs to keep this kind of argument in private, I didn't come to a party to deal with this drama…"

He chugged another beer and sighed, as no one was really sure what to say to that. They all knew Paul was being an asshole, but Erika really lost her cool, and they weren't sure who to blame. Most of them didn't even want to get involved, since it wasn't their problem.

The only one who knew the truth was Tammy, who said, "Brad, you know the reason she got all dressed up was because of you? She hasn't seen you in years, and she wanted to impress you. Don't let what Paul did ruin what you think of her!"

"For me? Well that's flattering… I mean I used to like her back in the day, and she's really cute. But I'm staying away from this drama, it really doesn't involve me…" Brad sighed.

The rest of the night, everyone tried to move on to other things, but the awkward air never really cleared. Eventually everyone made excuses to leave early, and the only ones left were Tammy and John, and of course Paul who pretty much refused to talk to anyone. Before Tammy left, she headed to Erika's room and knocked.

"Hey… can I come in?"

Tammy could hear muffled crying through the door, and she knew exactly why. Through all of that she heard a weak sounding "Yeah…" and opened the door to see Erika burying her face in her pillow.

"Well, the party's over. Were you really serious about moving out? I think Paul's still in denial." Tammy said, sitting on the edge of Erika's bed.

"Yeah I'm serious, would you want to live with a creep like him for one more day?" She said muffled through pillow and tears.

"I know, it's probably for the best. Listen, how about you come stay at my place tonight? Then we'll get everything packed up tomorrow, and you can stay with me until you find a new place to stay. It'll be fun, like sleepovers again!" Tammy said with a smile, trying to cheer her up.

It seemed to work, as Erika rolled over onto her back and returned a tear-filled smile. "Thanks, that would mean a lot to me… I guess I really didn't think this through. By the way, uh… What happened to Brad? Is he gone already?"

Tammy nodded, "Yeah… I think you kinda blew it with him. He thinks you're a drama queen now. To be fair, to someone who doesn't know what happened, you were pretty much acting like one."

"I don't suppose I could explain what happened to him?"

"It's too late for that, sorry. Maybe there will be another chance, but he's gone for now. You really should just get that out of your mind, you still want to come with me?"

"I just need to change and pack some things and I'll be right with you…"

Erika changed into more comfortable clothes, some jeans and a low cut t-shirt, and a pair of tennis shoes, then packed a change of clothes and some other belongings in a bag. Tammy helped her get everything packed and they left the house within the hour. They left Paul behind to stew in his own shame for how he tried to take advantage of a girl with memory loss. Tammy's boyfriend went back to his own place, leaving her and Erika to have her whole apartment to themselves.

It was quite a small apartment however, with only a single bedroom. Tammy apologized, "Yeah it's my only bed, so I guess I could take the couch tonight and you can have my bed."

"Why? We're both girls, can't we just share a bed? It's big enough for two." Erika pointed out, but avoiding eye contact with her friend.

Tammy smiled, "Oh yeah? Well if it makes you feel better, then sure thing!"

The two girls hung out in her room for about an hour, helping Erika recover more of her memories. She began remembering things about Tammy and having been in this apartment in the past. Her mood definitely began to improve when she felt like memories were starting to come easier again. Finally though, they both realized how late it was, and Erika was about to pass out from exhaustion and all the alcohol from earlier.

"Yeah I think I'm about to pass out… how about we call it a night?" Erika mumbled, while hugging a pillow for comfort.

Tammy agreed, and stood up to begin undressing, right there in front of Erika. She didn't even seem to think twice about it, but Erika felt like somehow this was wrong. She caught a glimpse of Tammy's bare breasts as her bra came off, and she slipped on an oversized t-shirt that she liked to sleep in. When Tammy turned around, she caught her still staring at her body in awe.

"Come on Erika… you've seen my body before, it's not like I have anything to be jealous of. You're so much more athletic than I am, look at you!"

But Erika shook her head, trying to hide her eyes, "No… it's not that. You're really pretty Tammy, I'm serious." Tammy smiled and thanked her, figuring it was just the drinks talking. But Erika corrected herself. "What I mean is… before my memory loss, was I ever uh… I was straight right?"

Tammy simply blinked as she processed the question. A moment later her face flushed red, "Uhh… I think so? Are you umm… Are you trying to say…?" She suddenly looked very self-conscious.

"I don't know! I always thought I was straight, but… the way you undressed just now." Erika attempted to explain, "Look I'm not saying anything, I know you aren't into that, and you've got a boyfriend. But I felt something for sure! A very strong attraction… God this is embarrassing…"

"Well, maybe you were always bi, but you never told me about that. If you were, then you hid it quite well. I never suspected a thing! It's ok if you are… but it does make things a bit awkward now."

"Uh, why? It's not like all of a sudden I'm going to try and sleep with you. I'm just discovering these feelings for the first time, and I can't seem to recall any memory of feeling this way about others of my own gender before. So maybe hitting my head did more than knock a few memories loose…"

Tammy laughed, "I don't think that's how science works, girl, but alright. If you think a bump to the head turned you bi, then that's your business. But I'm not going to judge, let's just get some sleep alright? You can go change in the bathroom if it makes you more comfortable!"

With the revelation that she wasn't as straight as she once thought, Erika leaves to change into comfortable shorts and a shirt to sleep in. She climbs into Tammy's bed, and makes sure she is facing away from her, just in case she gets any lewd thoughts during the night. She had to do her best not to think that right behind her was her cute friend wearing barely any clothing, and hoped that she fell asleep quickly.

She took some painkillers from the light hangover she was feeling. Tammy was still sleeping, however, and Erika caught herself multiple times staring at her sleeping body, feeling aroused. Eventually, she knew she would have to accept this as fact.

An hour later, Tammy finally groggily rolled out of bed, looking like a mess. She looked over and saw Erika reading something on her phone, shocked that her friend was such an early riser, and was already dressed and made up!

"Morning..." Tammy said as she wandered towards the adjoining bathroom to fix her hair. "Sorry, I slept in, not used to having friends that wake up so early..."

Erika just smiled, "No biggie, I was just reading through my Facebook, trying to learn more about my friends and people I know from school. I started remembering who more of them are now, which is nice!"

"That's great, girl. Give me some time to get ready and then we can figure out what to do today."

It was nearly mid-day when Tammy was finally ready, having slept in quite a bit. She made some quick breakfast for the two of them, and then they knew they had to decide what to do.

"So this whole moving out thing, you're still doing it, right?"

Erika nodded, "Absolutely! I can't stand being in the same house as that creep anymore... I still don't have many memories of him, but from what I do remember, Paul and I were never close, that much is certain. I don't think he was ever THIS bad, though. He must have seen my amnesia as a chance to take advantage of me after all this time holding back."

"I know, it's disgusting when you think about it that way. He was always a bit weird, but I never took him for the sort to go that far. If you hadn't gained your memories back, he could have brainwashed you into being his loyal girlfriend, maybe even for the rest of your life, who knows? But you know you have friends like me who have your back, and we would have known you weren't acting like yourself."

"You did just that, at the party, thank you! Just the thought of what he could have gotten away with makes me sick. Before you woke up, I rented a moving truck that we can go pick up. I can put most of my things in storage until I find a new place, but I just want it all out of there before Paul gets his dirty hands on anything of mine." She said with a sneer.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Over the next few hours, Tammy and Erika went back to her and Paul's apartment and started packing up all of her things. They unloaded mountains of clothes from her closet, packing them hastily into boxes. Aside from her outfits and bathroom effects, there wasn't much else that she owned. Most of the furniture was Paul's.

Paul watched with his hands over his head, as they hauled out her TV and tons of boxes full of her belongings. Erika personally packed up her Macbook as well, since that had all of her photos and school work on it. By the end of the day, they had a truck full of her stuff, and even a dresser and some other bedroom furniture. Some of, like the bed, was too heavy for the girls to carry by themselves, so they just left it behind.

Erika approached Paul once everything was ready to go, and gave him a look of utter contempt. "As you can see, I wasn't kidding about moving out. Consider our friendship done, and I hope I never see you again." She handed him a check with the last bit of rent, shoving it in his face. "Don't try to contact me, alright?"

He looked dejected, as though she was breaking up with him, even though they were never together in the first place. Though in his mind, he'd at least convinced her to be his girlfriend for a day, and his disturbing dreams were crushed. "Yeah... I understand. You know I'm so-"

"Shut up! I don't want to hear it! Sorry isn't going to help anyone. The only thing you can do to repay me is never to put another girl through this again. You hear me?"

Paul nodded, and Erika promptly stormed out of the house, hoping never to see his face again. She was about to get in the moving truck when she stopped in her tracks. She saw someone familiar talking to Tammy...

As she got closer, the young man looked at her, and there was immediately a look of recognition on his face. He even waved to her, but Tammy was giving him a look like she didn't trust him.

But Erika thought he looked familiar, like REALLY familiar for some reason. She knew this guy must be someone she used to know, and hoped that the memory of him would return quickly.

"Hey, there you are! It's been over a whole day since you went missing, where were you?" The man asked as Erika approached.

She raised an eyebrow to Tammy, hoping she would know what this was about, but she just shrugged, having no clue.

Erika nodded, "Just fine! I'm actually packing up and moving. I'm sorry I... This is embarrassing, but I forgot your name?"

"Remote?" Erika asked, as suddenly a synapse snapped in her head.

Memories began flowing faster than she'd ever had before. But they weren't her own memories; they were someone else's. She remembered this man, Roy, extremely well. In fact, she realized these new memories were from Roy's own perspective. She remembered going to work at a Burger joint, dropping out of college, and living with this guy Jack and his girlfriend, Sarah. She remembered her name especially, as though it held more significance than Jack's. Then she remembered the remote, and being visited by Roy from another dimension, and having the remote thrust upon her... him. These were memories of when Roy got the remote. But was she Roy too? How could she be Roy if he was standing right here? She was Erika, and she knew she had plenty of memories from her life as Erika that had resurfaced over the past day. Why was she suddenly doubting herself?

"I...I'm sorry what?" Erika held her head, suddenly getting a splitting headache from the rush of information. "How can you be Roy... I thought... These memories..."

"Trigger memories?" Roy asked, "What's going on? Is that why you don't know me?"

"Yesterday she was jogging and collapsed in mid run... She hit her head pretty hard and basically forgot who she was."

"Yeah, I was lucky this girl Serena found me, she's a pre-med student and made sure I wasn't in any real danger. Guess my head just got knocked around that's all." Erika shrugged. "But you, I remember you now... And the remote."

"Remote?" Tammy worried, "What's this about? What do you remember about him?"

"It's alright Tam, he's... He's a friend; you don't have to worry. We go way back." Erika explained.

Roy nodded, "That's right."

"Then how come I've never met you? I've known Erika for a long time and never seen you around!" Tammy challenged him.

"It's ok Tammy, I've actually known him a lot longer than I've known you. I got a lot of new memories when he showed up, and I know I can trust him, alright?"

"Alright... But don't blame me for being jumpy after Paul took advantage of you in your state."

"Who's Paul?" Roy blinked, wondering just how much he had missed.

"He's my piece of shit roommate. Well, ex-roommate now, as you can see. I'm packed up and getting out of here."

"And... Where are you moving to? Are you moving in with your friend here?"

Tammy put her hands on her hips, "Hey, I'm standing right here still!"

Curious about what would happen, Roy grabbed a bottle of beer from his fridge. He set it on a fridge near the window, pointed the device at it, and pressed the button.

Roy was expecting a flash of light, or maybe some momentary disorientation, but there was none of that. All that happened was, quietly and without any fuss, the nerdy girl replacing his bottle of beer.

It took Roy a few minutes to recover from his amazement, but he soon did and began to examine the girl. She had shrunk to the size of the glass bottle, and was nude except for a paper label wrapped around her torso. The label read 'Chloe Anderson' in large letters; Roy supposed that had been her name, and it was now her brand. Chloe was standing straight, with her arms at her side, her feet together, and a blank expression on her pretty face. She was perfectly still, not even appearing to breath. Cautiously, Roy reached out and picked her up. She was nice and chilly, just like a beer should be, and Roy noted that her skin had the texture of flesh, but was hard and inflexible. Turning Chloe over, Roy saw that the back of the label held information on her calories and serving size, as well as a small blurb about how she was brewed with only the finest Rocky Mountain spring water and premium hops. Roy also noticed, with some amusement, that she was apparently also available in Chloe Original, Chloe Lite, and Chloe Draft varieties. Turning her back over, he noticed a strange line around her neck; a few moment's experimentation revealed that her head unscrewed off her neck, revealing that her insides were filled with a strange-smelling beer. Roy was troubled by this; was he supposed to drink her? Roy shrugged and put that thought aside for the moment. After all, she was a bottle of beer now, not a human, and beers are for drinking.

Having finished his examination of Chloe, Roy put her back down on the table and went back to the window to see if he could find the beer that had taken her place. He was in luck, for there it was; Chloe had been headed out to her car to get something, but it was the beer bottle that was now returning inside. It was human-sized, of course, and wearing the clothes that formerly belonged to Chloe: black skirt and Battlestar Galactica sweatshirt. Its cap had a design printed on it that resembled the bun Chloe's hair had been in, and below that were the glasses, wedged around its neck, and the lipstick, bright red against the dark glass. It even still had the backpack, although Roy couldn't figure out what was holding it up. He couldn't see the tights or boots, presumably because the bottle didn't need them; it just slid smoothly along the pavement of the parking lot. The bottle looked empty, which made sense, as all the beer was in Chloe now. On its way back in to the building, the bottle was stopped by another girl, who Roy recognized as Chloe's roommate. He couldn't hear their conversation, of course, but Roy noticed that the other girl didn't seem at all confused or bothered by the fact that she was talking to a five-and-a-half foot glass bottle instead of a human girl.

Shaking his head in wonder at the strange power of the device, Roy sat down at the table and gazed at Chloe while he pondered his next move. On one hand, he really should be getting to work by now. On the other hand... now that he had this device, work didn't seem really important anymore. Maybe he should call in sick, and see what else this device could do. And then, there was a part of him that really wanted to know what Chloe tasted like...

Roy looked out his second-story apartment window, down into the parking lot below and scanned the crowd for a suitable test subject to experiment on. He quickly zeroed in on a wealthy-looking woman out walking a small, white poodle. The woman didn't look familiar to Roy. He surmised she was perhaps out “slumming,” visiting some poorer neighborhoods to show off her own good fortune.

Roy guessed the woman was in her early forties. She wore an expensive-looking pink suit – a bright, pink jacket with a white blouse beneath, paired with a matching, short pink skirt. Her legs were sheathed in unblemished, pure white tights. She clicked smartly along the pavement on a pair of bright pink, stiletto heels. In one hand, she carried a bright pink handbag... in the other, she held the leash attached to the dog. Roy could see an elegant string of pearls around the woman's neck. She was wearing what looked to be gold bracelets and sparkling, diamond earrings.

Smiling mischievously, Roy pointed the device out the window and aimed it directly at the woman. After pushing the button, he pointed the gizmo back at himself and pushed the other button.

Instantly, he found himself outside holding the lady's purse in one hand and the dog leash in the other.

“It... it really worked!” said Roy.

He looked down at himself: he was physically male but now completely dressed in the rich woman's clothes. Somehow, they had all magically been adjusted in size to perfectly fit his body.

The poodle looked up at Roy and barked, eager to continue their walk. Apparently the dog was utterly unaware that Roy was not its original original.

“In a minute, in a minute!” Roy impatiently told the animal.

Still restraining the dog with one hand, Roy dug around best he could in the strange woman's purse. His hands were still large, masculine and a bit hairy – but his nails had grown out and were lacquered with a thick, glossy coat of burgundy nail polish. He also wore a series of expensive looking gold and silver rings, encrusted with various small diamonds, emeralds, and rubies. A particularly large, expensive looking woman's wedding ring was now wrapped around one finger.

After a big of digging through the woman's purse, Roy managed to find a makeup case with a mirror. Holding up the mirror to his face, he examined himself. He was still obviously Roy, but his ears were now pierced and he was definitely wearing expensive looking diamond jewelry. He also wore a thick coating of bright pink lipstick, sparkling gray eyeshadow, and heavy, black mascara. He cheeks seemed to be painted with a combination of foundation makeup and blush, evidently in an effort to hide the middle-aged woman's early wrinkles. Roy's hair had now grown out considerably and hung just above his shoulders. It was carefully styled like a rich, 40-something woman's hair would be. He touched it and found it was coated with a hard, crunchy layer of hairspray to hold everything perfectly in place.

All in all, Roy found his reflection resembled that of an older sister or aunt – obviously related to Roy, but with all the hair and makeup done, he actually looked mostly feminine now. His stocking-clad legs had been shaved smooth too, he noticed. Other than his flat chest, broad-shouldered build, and large, masculine hands, there were no obvious signs he wasn't actually a rich, middle-aged woman now.

Roy could feel he was still physically male where it counted. But he also felt the strange, silky, smooth presence of this strange woman's panties rubbing against his body.

“I wonder who exactly I am,” he muttered aloud.

The poodle barked impatiently.

Roy continued to dig through the purse until he finally came up with a driver's license. With some surprise, he recognized the photo in the license was now the face he'd just seen in the mirror. Apparently reality had been altered so everyone believed Roy's body now matched up with this strange, rich lady's life.

“My name is... Charlotte Veronica Walton,” said Roy.

He quickly zeroed in on a wealthy-looking woman out walking a small, white poodle. The woman didn't look familiar to Roy. He surmised she was perhaps out �slumming,� visiting some poorer neighborhoods to show off her own good fortune.

Roy guessed the woman was in her early forties. She wore an expensive-looking pink suit � a bright, pink jacket with a white blouse beneath, paired with a matching, short pink skirt. Her legs were sheathed in unblemished, pure white tights. She clicked smartly along the pavement on a pair of bright pink, stiletto heels. She was wearing what looked to be gold bracelets and sparkling, diamond earrings. Roy could see an elegant string of pearls around the woman's neck. In one hand, she carried a bright pink handbag... in the other, she held the leash attached to the dog.

The dog itself was a short, small creature. Its fur had been carefully shaved into a couple of bouncy, puffy, bouffants. It was yipping loudly and straining against its leash, eager to continue walking through the neighborhood.

Smiling mischievously, Roy pointed the device out the window and aimed it directly at the loudly yapping poodle. After pushing the button, he pointed the gizmo back at himself and pushed the other button.

Instantly, Roy found himself elsewhere.

The first thing he noticed was that he was completely nude.

The next thing he noticed was that he was considerably smaller, shorter... and bent over on all fours.

Cocking his head around to survey his surroundings, Roy discovered he was outdoors now... naked in the cool, morning air!

A collar was wrapped loosely about his neck and attached to an expensive-looking leather leash. Roy looked back to see where the leash lead. There, he saw the rich woman from before, now scowling angrily at him and jabbering nonsensically.

What's she saying, Roy wondered.

Then it dawned on him � everything he saw was now in muted shades of gray. He was no longer capable of seeing color. He had switched places with the poodle and now possessed its black-and-white vision.

If that was the case, then had Roy also lost the ability to understand and use human speech?

He struggled to understand the woman's furious jibberjabber, but it was in vain.

Hesitantly, Roy opened his own mouth and tried to speak.

�Bark, bark, bark!� he said.

In an angry huff, the towering woman above him started to press on further, walking ahead of Roy. A moment later, he felt the tug of the collar around his neck... and he was forced to pad along on all fours behind the woman, naked in the great outdoors.

Slowly he realized what was going on... the maid with whom he'd switched roles must have been a French woman by birth; she spoke English as a second language. And now, so do Roy. It was just like what had happened with the dog, when Roy had been were unable to speak or understand human language at all. Did that mean he could French fluently now? He'd never been able to get much beyond "Voulez-vous couchez avec moi ce soir?" before.

The woman looked at Roy coldly. "I know what you were doing," she said. "Stop fluffing yourself up in front of the mirror and get back to work, you little floozy." Ouch, clearly she didn't think much of Roy. She gave him a hard stare, and then something seemed to catch her eye. "Yvette, what's that in your hand?"

"Oh," Roy said, looking down at the device, "um, ah found this while I was cleaning. I don't know what it is."

"It looks like an invention from my husband's company," the woman said, storming over and snatching the device from Roy's hand. "Did my husband give this to you?"

"No, no," Roy said, trying to hide his panic over the device being out of his hands, "like ah said, I found it while cleaning. Ah was going to ask you about it."

"I'll ask my husband myself, thank you very much," the woman said. She started to walk to the door, then she turned abruptly. "Yvette, you're THIS close to getting fired," she said, holding her fingers very, VERY close together. "You give me one more reason and you're out the door for good." She looked Roy up and down. "And I really don't think that outfit is appropriate for work. I don't care what my husband says. Tomorrow I expect you to be dressed more modestly." She turned again and slammed the door shut behind her.

"Quelle vache," Roy muttered when she was gone. And yet, he thought he understood the reason for the woman's anger. He guessed the woman believed Roy--or, rather, Yvette--was having an affair with her husband. And maybe she was... the clues were all there. Roy's slutty outfit and the fact that the woman's husband had apparently insisted he wear it; her "floozy" remark; the fact that she believed her husband had given Roy the device.

Roy had more important things to worry about than the little soap opera that was going on in this household, however. He had to get the device back. He wanted to look for it right away... his position as maid would give him the freedom to snoop around the house a little to find where the woman had hidden it. On the other hand, the woman seemed serious about firing Roy... if Roy did anything at all to upset the woman further, he might get fired and lose access to the house, and thus any hope he had of getting to the device. He might end up trapped as Yvette for the rest of his life! Perhaps it was safer to give the woman a couple of days to cool off before he started looking for the device... he could survive a couple of days as a pretty French woman.

info.brief_description: An ordinary man is given an extraordinary device that swaps people's life roles around
info.description:
The original Role Swapper story was sadly deleted a while ago, so I decided to make a new one! I'm keeping the first chapter the same, but rest assured everything after will be new. Do feel free to add chapters, but please try to keep your chapters WAY longer than one sentence, a paragraph at least. Have fun!

Original description from SandySeeker:

"Roy Milford is a washed-up failure at age 23. But after a visit from an oddly familiar extradimensional stranger, Roy gains access to an incredible device capable of Role Swapping – putting one person into the life of another individual. Can Roy use this amazing machine to turn his own life around? Or will he just make things worse?

Add whatever you'd like! Pretty much any sort of transformation is welcome. Feel free to create new characters, push existing ones in different directions, flesh-out the background of any characters you like... or even abandon the main character and give the device to somebody else! Anything goes, so long as you're being creative and having fun with the story. Interesting plot twists and unexpected happenings are always welcome! Thanks in advance to all the wonderfully interesting additions I know you'll be adding.

Be creative. Be imaginative. Be wild. Be daring. Be unexpected."

Be fresh and original, and have fun with it!"
